clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of SARS Caused by COVID-19 With Ruxolitinib
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Caused by COVID-19 With Ruxolitinib

brief_summary.textblock:
In December 2019, a new virus emerged in Wuhan, China rapidly becoming a pandemic with
      registered cases above 800,000 around the world. The virus is now known as SARS-CoV2 calling
      its disease coronavirus-19 or COVID-19. The mortality of the virus has been reported around
      2-10% and its causes because of the proinflammatory immune response generated on the host.
      The cytokines involved in the immune response to COVID-19 are IL-1, IL-2, IL4, IL-6, IL-10,
      IL-12, IL-13, IL-17, GCSF, MCSF, IP-10, MCP-1, MIP-1α, HGF, IFN-γ y TNF-α.

      Ruxolitinib is an inhibitor of JAK 1/2 which is responsable for multiple cellular signals
      including the proinflammatory IL-6. Ruxolitinib works as and immunomodulator decreasing the
      cytotoxic T lymphocytes and increasing the Treg cells.

      This study is intended to stop the disregulated immune response caused by COVID-19 that
      generates the pneumonia and subsequent severe acute respiratory syndrome.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Use of ruxolitinib on patients with respiratory distress and pneumonia changes on chest computed tomography

primary_outcome.description: Presence of recovery of pneumonia characterized by cease of respiratory symptoms

secondary_outcome.description: Increment or decrease in mg/ml of C-reactive protein
Increment or decrease in ng/ml of ferritin
Increment or decrease in mg/ml of D-dimer
Requirement of Intensive Care Unit on the patients under treatment
Requirement of mechanical ventilation on the patients under treatment
Time since the diagnosis to the last follow up (recovery or death)
Rate of adverse events associated with ruxolitinib

arm_group.description: Ruxolitinib 10 mg BID since the beginning of dyspnea or increment of work of breathing with pneumonia changes in chest CT-scan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with diagnosed COVID-19 with confirmatory test

          -  Increase in work of breathing or presence of dyspnea

          -  Presence of lung changes associated with COVID pneumonia by chest imaging

          -  Informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnancy or breastfeeding

          -  Thrombocytopenia below 20,000 cells/mm3

          -  Neutropenia below 500 cels/mm3

          -  Known and active infection of HIV, Hepatitis C, Hepatitis B, Herpes Zoster or
             Mycobacterium Tuberculosis
